intro: Malmeanthus hilarii, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a waxy coating, which contributes to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
